content: basic beginner s hat by maggie billings skill level finished size 21 circumference 8 5 total height fits adult head size about 21-23 /53-58 5cm gauge 20 sts x 26 row = 4 /10cm in stockinette stitch adjust needle size to match gauge if needed materials ● 130-190 yards of #4 medium worsted weight yarn samples shown in cascade pacific black and knitpicks wool of the andes worsted gray take time to check gauge with each yarn ● us size 8 5mm circular knitting needles with a 16 cable ● us size 8 5mm double-pointed needles ● stitch markers ● measuring tape or ruler ● tapestry needle for weaving in ends abbreviations bor beginning of the round p purl co cast on pm place stitch marker dpn double pointed needles round round k knit st/sts stitch/stitches k2tog knit two stitches together as if ** instructions between asterisks will they were one stitch be repeated for all of the stitches in the round pattern notes instructions are given for both a beanie shown in gray and a watch cap with a longer brim that can be folded over shown in black the only difference is brim length the height of the hat can be changed by knitting more row in the brim or body keeping in mind that the crown decreases will add about 3 /7 6 cm ⓒ 2022 maggie billings maggiebillingsknits@gmail com instructions cast on co 85 stitches using the long-tail cast on being careful not to twist the stitches join to work in the round by knitting the first stitch cast on together with the last stitch cast on you now have 84 sts place a marker pm here to mark the beginning of the round bor brim knit the first stitch purl the next stitch repeat this pattern to work k1 p1 ribbing for 1 5 /3 75cm for the beanie or 4 /10cm for the watch cap body once the ribbing is the correct length knit every stitch of every row stockinette stitch for 4 5 /11 5cm your entire project will now measure 6 /16 25cm for the beanie or 8 5 /23cm for the watch cap from the co edge crown shaping begin decreasing to make the crown of the hat as follows switching from a circular needle to dpn s as the circumference of the hat gets too small for the circular needles each odd-numbered round will reduce the total stitches on your needles by 7 creating a spiral pattern every even-numbered round will be knit without decreasing after round 4 only odd-numbered rounds are written out all even-numbered rounds will be knit like round 2 fill in the box by each round after you ve completed it to keep track of where you are round 1 *knit 10 knit two together * repeat until the end of the round you ll be left with 77 total stitches you should finish the round on a k2tog round 2 knit one round round 3
